intro: Microcharis angolensis, commonly known as the Angola spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial herb that produces small, delicate leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Microcharis angolensis is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
